<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/airbnb-books-big-sponsorship-olympics?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Airbnb Takes Talents From Spring Break to the Olympics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Airbnb at the olympics " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTE0MDM4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Airbnb has inked a reported <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/3d5e5684-09d0-11ea-bb52-34c8d9dc6d84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$500 million</a> deal to sponsor the Olympic Games until 2028. Like a sun-soaked two-bedroom rental in Williamsburg, this one promises a lot. Can it deliver?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Airbnb <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/sofialottopersio/2019/11/18/airbnb-olympic-partnership-ahead-ipo/#4346a3da57a1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will support</a> the next five Olympics—in Tokyo, Beijing, Paris, Milan, and LA—with housing for visitors and workers. The storied Olympic Village <em>won’t</em> be replaced with Airbnb housing, because being an RA for <a href="https://www.espn.com/olympics/summer/2012/story/_/id/8133052/athletes-spill-details-dirty-secrets-olympic-village-espn-magazine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">frisky superathletes</a> is less fun than it sounds.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">For the cities…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s a win.</strong> The International Olympic Committee (IOC) <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-airbnb-policies/airbnb-teams-up-with-the-ioc-to-provide-games-accommodation-idUSKBN1XS1AH?feedType=RSS&feedName=businessNews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requires</a> candidate cities to guarantee 40,000 rooms to house an influx of visitors. And if they are selected, that means billions of dollars spent on infrastructure projects that might go unused once the games end.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For the 2018 games, the local government in Pyeongchang, South Korea, paid nearly $13 billion, </span><span><a href="https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/economics-hosting-olympic-games?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost double</a></span><span> the original projection, per the Council on Foreign Relations.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beijing 2008 cost over $45 billion, and Sochi 2014 topped $50 billion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cities do get a quick tourism boost from hosting, but that <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/18/business/airbnb-ioc-olympics-deal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rarely cancels out</a> those eye-popping expenses. Airbnb plans to lighten the load by marshaling its 200,000 combined hosts in the five cities.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">For Airbnb...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s prepping to go public next year.</strong> This deal will 1) shore up support in five of its biggest markets and 2) get Airbnb’s brand in front of <a href="https://www.vox.com/2018/2/26/17044010/pyeongchang-winter-olympics-2018-ratings-sochi-russia-watched?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tens of millions</a> nightly as part of a “worldwide sponsorship programme” alongside heavy hitters like Coca-Cola, Alibaba, and P&G.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But like racewalking, there’s always drama with Airbnb. </strong>Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo alerted the IOC to the “<a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/soccer/2019/11/18/airbnb-signs-up-as-olympic-sponsor-through-2028-games/40640889/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">risks and consequences</a>” of working with Airbnb, a company Paris took legal action against this year after accusing it of driving city rents higher.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/president-trump-fed-chair-jerome-powell-meet-talk-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Powell Goes in for the Hug, Trump for the Fist Bump
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTE1MzkwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The Washington Post<span class="asset-detail__artist-title-divider"> / </span><span class="asset-detail__artist-title">Contributor </span></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President Trump and Fed Chair Jerome Powell sat down for a <a href="https://apnews.com/1b819d9b90b54e9dac9d24e989f42b28?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meeting</a> so awkward even Borat turned down an invite.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The chat lasted 30 minutes and, according to Trump, the two leaders discussed everything from negative interest rates to inflation to dollar strength to trade. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin was also there. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Why so cringy: </strong></span><span>The president thinks the Fed chair hasn’t given the economy the massage it’s needed. Trump </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-chairman-powell-trump-meet-discuss-economy-11574092396?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has called</a></span><span> Powell a “terrible communicator” and wondered on Twitter whether the Fed chair was a bigger enemy to the country than Chinese President Xi Jinping. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The last time Trump and Powell met face-to-face was at a dinner in February. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But after the meeting, both did their best postgame Bill Belichick impressions.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Trump:</strong></span><span> The chat was “very good & cordial,” he tweeted. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fed:</strong></span><span> “Chair Powell’s comments were consistent with his remarks at his congressional hearings last week.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Powell has <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/799a4a18-0a1b-11ea-b2d6-9bf4d1957a67?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut interest rates</a> by 75 basis points this year, but he appears to be hitting pause for the foreseeable future.</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BEAUTY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/coty-buys-majority-stake-kylie-cosmetics?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kylie Jenner Is a Business, Woman
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Kylie Cosmetics " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTE2ODAxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Dee Delgado/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Business mogul Kylie Jenner has sold a majority stake in her cosmetics company to struggling beauty business Coty.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Coty, the world’s <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/11/18/coty-majority-owner-of-kylie-jenner-cosmetics/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third-largest</a> beauty company, <a href="https://wwd.com/beauty-industry-news/color-cosmetics/kylie-jenner-sells-majority-stake-in-beauty-business-to-coty-1203372780/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paid $600 million</a> for a 51% stake in Kylie Cosmetics, valuing the makeup/skincare company at about $1.2 billion. Kylie, relentless in her campaign to unseat Kim as Kris’s favorite, is on track to do $200 million in Kylie Cosmetics sales this year, according to Coty. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Coty, this year is really about, like, the year of realizing stuff.</strong> Like how it’ll be worse off than a walnut scrub in 2019 unless it taps into younger audiences.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coty acquired dozens of brands from P&G in a 2016 deal...then took $4 billion in writedowns on that deal this year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Coty stock’s lost </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kylie-jenner-sells-600-million-stake-in-beauty-business-11574084772?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half its value</a></span><span> since the deal.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Coty’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-18/coty-buys-majority-stake-in-kylie-cosmetic-line-for-600-million?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not alone</a> in seeking out celebrity-endorsed, social media-approved brands. Estée Lauder bought the remaining share of Korean skincare line Have & Be it didn’t already own for roughly $1.1 billion yesterday, and Shiseido bought Drunk Elephant for $845 million in October.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RIDE-HAILING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/juno-leaves-new-york?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Juno Writes a “Why I’m Leaving New York” Essay
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Juno's sad website" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTEwNjM0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Juno's sad website</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s one fewer four-letter word New Yorkers can use when they’re in a hurry. The ride-hailing startup Juno is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-18/juno-once-billed-as-the-anti-uber-shuts-down-in-new-york?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shutting down operations</a> in NYC, owner Gett announced yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But surely we aren’t expected to use the subway? Oh good. Gett is transferring its corporate clients to Lyft beginning next year through a strategic partnership (Gett says it serves over 15,000 companies, down from the 20k it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/07/gett-raises-200m-at-1-5b-valuation-for-its-b2b-ride-hailing-service-aims-for-2020-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told TechCrunch about</a> earlier this year). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Juno launched in NYC in 2016 as your </span><span><a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/gyz787/juno-was-supposed-to-be-the-ethical-uber-then-it-sold-out-and-died?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">friendly neighborhood ride-hailer,</a></span><span> promising drivers equity, higher pay, and an option to be classified as employees.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gett, an Israeli ride-hailer last valued at $1.5 billion, acquired Juno in 2017 for $200 million and those generous packages never materialized.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gett <a href="https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/gett-announces-closure-of-juno-and-strategic-partnership-with-lyft-300960004.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cited</a> “the enactment of misguided regulations” and an increased focus on enterprise customers as reasons for pulling the plug on Juno. Gett is also looking to IPO in the near future, so it at least wants to give off the <em>appearance </em>it could one day be profitable.</p>

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/18/different-beast-tiktoks-changing-social-media?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Different Beast: How TikTok’s Changing Social Media
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Business Casual logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTE1NjAxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s been a big week for TikTok. </strong>The social video app reportedly passed 1.5 billion downloads worldwide, putting it ahead of both Facebook and Instagram. It started testing online shopping in the U.S. It’s also under the microscope in D.C. as a Chinese-owned entity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And now, it’s getting the </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">treatment. </strong>This week on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast, we attempt to understand TikTok—what makes it work, why it blew up, and how companies are making money off of it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because TikTok isn’t like Facebook or Google. According to viral TikTok superstar Spencer X (follower count: 9.8 million), TikTok’s got a few competitive advantages that have Zuck worried.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spencer X tells us…</strong>a) how TikTok has made live streaming work in both theory and practice b) the brands that are best suited to monetize via TikTok and c) why influencer marketing is a force to be reckoned with.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen now:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/SpencerX_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/SpencerX_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/SpencerX_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

WHERE U AT?

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lawrence, Kansas, is now a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-18/kansas-draws-enough-brain-power-to-make-it-a-top-tech-hub?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top 20 tech hub</a> in the U.S. according to Bloomberg—we’re guessing being home to the University of Kansas has something to do with it. And you know what’s coming next...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Two-part college town trivia. </strong>In Game #1, we’ll give you the city and you name the college that’s located in it. And in Game #2, we’ll give you the college, you name the city.</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Flagstaff, Arizona</span></li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Game #2</strong></p>

Olympics\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Airbnb at the olympics \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAirbnb has inked a reported \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3d5e5684-09d0-11ea-bb52-34c8d9dc6d84?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$500 million\u003c/a\u003e deal to sponsor the Olympic Games until 2028. Like a sun-soaked two-bedroom rental in Williamsburg, this one promises a lot. Can it deliver?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eAirbnb \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/sofialottopersio/2019/11/18/airbnb-olympic-partnership-ahead-ipo/#4346a3da57a1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill support\u003c/a\u003e the next five Olympics—in Tokyo, Beijing, Paris, Milan, and LA—with housing for visitors and workers. The storied Olympic Village \u003cem\u003ewon’t\u003c/em\u003e be replaced with Airbnb housing, because being an RA for \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/olympics/summer/2012/story/_/id/8133052/athletes-spill-details-dirty-secrets-olympic-village-espn-magazine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efrisky superathletes\u003c/a\u003e is less fun than it sounds.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFor the cities…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s a win.\u003c/strong\u003e The International Olympic Committee (IOC) \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-airbnb-policies/airbnb-teams-up-with-the-ioc-to-provide-games-accommodation-idUSKBN1XS1AH?feedType=RSS\u0026feedName=businessNews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequires\u003c/a\u003e candidate cities to guarantee 40,000 rooms to house an influx of visitors. And if they are selected, that means billions of dollars spent on infrastructure projects that might go unused once the games end.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor the 2018 games, the local government in Pyeongchang, South Korea, paid nearly $13 billion, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/economics-hosting-olympic-games?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost double\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the original projection, per the Council on Foreign Relations.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeijing 2008 cost over $45 billion, and Sochi 2014 topped $50 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCities do get a quick tourism boost from hosting, but that \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/18/business/airbnb-ioc-olympics-deal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erarely cancels out\u003c/a\u003e those eye-popping expenses. Airbnb plans to lighten the load by marshaling its 200,000 combined hosts in the five cities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFor Airbnb...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s prepping to go public next year.\u003c/strong\u003e This deal will 1) shore up support in five of its biggest markets and 2) get Airbnb’s brand in front of \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2018/2/26/17044010/pyeongchang-winter-olympics-2018-ratings-sochi-russia-watched?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etens of millions\u003c/a\u003e nightly as part of a “worldwide sponsorship programme” alongside heavy hitters like Coca-Cola, Alibaba, and P\u0026G.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut like racewalking, there’s always drama with Airbnb. \u003c/strong\u003eParis Mayor Anne Hidalgo alerted the IOC to the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/soccer/2019/11/18/airbnb-signs-up-as-olympic-sponsor-through-2028-games/40640889/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erisks and consequences\u003c/a\u003e” of working with Airbnb, a company Paris took legal action against this year after accusing it of driving city rents higher.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MTE1MzkwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Washington Post\u003cspan class=\"asset-detail__artist-title-divider\"\u003e / \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"asset-detail__artist-title\"\u003eContributor \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President Trump and Fed Chair Jerome Powell sat down for a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1b819d9b90b54e9dac9d24e989f42b28?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeeting\u003c/a\u003e so awkward even Borat turned down an invite.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe chat lasted 30 minutes and, according to Trump, the two leaders discussed everything from negative interest rates to inflation to dollar strength to trade. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin was also there. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy so cringy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe president thinks the Fed chair hasn’t given the economy the massage it’s needed. Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-chairman-powell-trump-meet-discuss-economy-11574092396?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas called\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Powell a “terrible communicator” and wondered on Twitter whether the Fed chair was a bigger enemy to the country than Chinese President Xi Jinping. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe last time Trump and Powell met face-to-face was at a dinner in February. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut after the meeting, both did their best postgame Bill Belichick impressions.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrump:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The chat was “very good \u0026 cordial,” he tweeted. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFed:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s one fewer four-letter word New Yorkers can use when they’re in a hurry. The ride-hailing startup Juno is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-18/juno-once-billed-as-the-anti-uber-shuts-down-in-new-york?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshutting down operations\u003c/a\u003e in NYC, owner Gett announced yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut surely we aren’t expected to use the subway? Oh good. Gett is transferring its corporate clients to Lyft beginning next year through a strategic partnership (Gett says it serves over 15,000 companies, down from the 20k it \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/07/gett-raises-200m-at-1-5b-valuation-for-its-b2b-ride-hailing-service-aims-for-2020-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold TechCrunch about\u003c/a\u003e earlier this year). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJuno launched in NYC in 2016 as your \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/gyz787/juno-was-supposed-to-be-the-ethical-uber-then-it-sold-out-and-died?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efriendly neighborhood ride-hailer,\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e promising drivers equity, higher pay, and an option to be classified as employees.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGett, an Israeli ride-hailer last valued at $1.5 billion, acquired Juno in 2017 for $200 million and those generous packages never materialized.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGett \u003ca href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/gett-announces-closure-of-juno-and-strategic-partnership-with-lyft-300960004.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecited\u003c/a\u003e “the enactment of misguided regulations” and an increased focus on enterprise customers as reasons for pulling the plug on Juno. Gett is also looking to IPO in the near future, so it at least wants to give off the \u003cem\u003eappearance \u003c/em\u003eit could one day be profitable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
